input_text:
Job Title: Director, Food Safety

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview

Direct and oversee the corporate Food Safety programs at Sprouts stores, distribution centers and with vendors, including private label vendors, such as the inspection/audit program to ensure compliance of products and processes to company and regulatory requirements. Develop, enhance, and maintain the processes, training, and standard operating procedures required to keep the Sprouts Food Safety programs amongst the best in class in the industry. The Director of Food safety must have subject matter expertise in food safety in a retail environment, including being versed in Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI) standards for retail, while also maintaining excellent working relationships with state and local health inspectors and agencies, vendor food safety experts, and internal stakeholders.

Overview Of Responsibilities

Oversight and management of Sprouts Food Safety Programs, including the inspection/audit program for stores, distribution centers and vendors and the corresponding Corrective Action Plan program, Preventive Controls / HACCP program, Food Code-based store and distribution center food safety programs, Sanitation Program, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and food safety complaint management process.Lead the implementation of new regulatory initiatives (e.g., FSMA Rule 204 Traceability plan), supply chain food safety assurance and best practices across the business regarding Food Safety systemsOversee supplier verification and monitoring risk management program, non-compliances, and corrective actions.Coordinate and respond to inquiries from Federal, State, and local agencies and serve as the key regulatory contactOversee and execute Sprouts food recall processes and traceability programsProvide technical support and strategic advice to senior leadership and other relevant stakeholders to ensure all food safety risks are well understood.Set clear vision, goals, and management systems and processes for Food Safety team Oversee field food safety personnel and associated programs such as internal audit programProactively drive continuous improvement process enhancementsMaintain and leverage data and metrics to help drive and positively influence regulatory compliance, company standard compliance, strategy, reporting, trend analysis, and early risk identificationDirect Employee Training of Food Safety Programs, Policies, and ProceduresServe as Crisis team lead on issues related to foodborne illness, product recalls, and consumer protection processes.Oversee food safety manager and specialists, providing guidance to ensure compliance with regulations and Sprouts policies, procedures, and requirementsEnsure all food and sanitation procedures, practices and policies reflect current regulatory compliance and food code standards for retail stores and distribution centers while establishing systemic processes to ensure these standards are met through formal internal auditing processesPromote and provide guidance on food safety culture for store operators, franchisees, and suppliersAdvise on any food safety or quality control issues that may represent enterprise risk and recommend appropriate mitigationsRepresents the Food Safety organization with industry trade association and best practice share groups


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Food Science or Biological ScienceExcellent knowledge of principles and applications of Food Safety programs including FSMA, FSVP, HACCP, GMP’s, GFSI, Sanitation, Allergens, Pathogens, Food Safety Plan programs and applicable certificationsSix (6) years of experience and responsibility for food safety within a related industryExperience developing, improving and implementing Food Safety programs such as change control, food safety culture, traceability or root cause analysis strongly preferredPrevious experience in retail grocery or food service strongly preferredCertified PCQI, Certified Food Safety Manager, Certified HACCP Manager and/or Certified ServSafe Instructor strongly preferredDemonstrated advanced knowledge of food safety programs and trends, including Retail Food Code, FDA and USDA regulationsExperience leading a Food Safety team strongly preferredEffective communication skills, both written and verbalStrong interpersonal skillsWorking knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Outlook and the InternetAbility to preserve confidentiality of information, communicate with all levels of management and work within strict time frames and resolute deadlinesSome travel required


Benefits

In addition to a rewarding career, Sprouts offers a comprehensive program to help support you and your family. These programs include:

Competitive paySick time plan that you can use to support you or your immediate families healthVacation accrual planOpportunities for career growth15% discount for you and one other family member in your household on all purchases made at SproutsFlexible schedulesEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)401(K) Retirement savings plan with a generous company matchCompany paid life insuranceContests and appreciation events throughout the year full of prizes, food and fun!


Eligibility Requirements May Apply For The Following Benefits

Bonus based on company and/or individual performanceAffordable benefit coverage, including medical, dental and visionHealth Savings Account with company matchPre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts for healthcare and dependent careCompany paid short-term disability coveragePaid parental leave for both mothers and fathersPaid holidays


Get Paid Every Day!

Sprouts Farmers Market offers DailyPay - if you’re hired as an eligible employee, you’ll be able to transfer the money you’ve already earned at no extra cost, and get it the next business day, for free. We offer DailyPay so you don’t have to wait for payday to access the money you’ve already worked for. With DailyPay, you can see how much you’ve made every day and you can transfer your money any time before payday.

You can learn more by visiting https://www.dailypay.com/partners/sprouts-farmers-market/.

Why Sprouts

Grow with us!

If you have a passion for inspiring people and a flair for fresh food, consider applying for a job at Sprouts! With a focus on customer service, our neighborhood grocery stores offer high-quality, farm fresh produce, natural meats, plenty of scoop-your-own bulk goods and much more in a fun, friendly, old-fashioned farmer’s market setting. Come grow your career in healthy living with a fast-paced, rapidly growing company and teams that pride themselves on empowering others along their journey.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned to this work. This is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and requirements. Sprouts’ management reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.

Sprouts will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance in Hiring Ordinance.

California Residents: We collect information in accordance with California law, please see here for more information.

Experience Level (if available): Director
